entry.name: resizable
entry.title: Resizable Widget
entry.desc: Change the size of an element using the mouse.

longdesc.p: The jQuery UI Resizable plugin makes selected elements resizable (meaning they have draggable resize handles). You can specify one or more handles as well as min and max width and height.

option.name: alsoResize
option.desc: One or more elements to resize synchronously with the resizable element.

option.name: animate
option.desc: Animates to the final size after resizing.

option.name: animateDuration
option.desc: How long to animate when using the animate option.

type.name: String
type.desc: A named duration, such as "slow" or "fast".

option.name: animateEasing
option.desc: Which easing to apply when using the animate option.

option.name: aspectRatio
option.desc: Whether the element should be constrained to a specific aspect ratio.

type.name: Boolean
type.desc: When set to true, the element will maintain its original aspect ratio.

type.name: Number
type.desc: Force the element to maintain a specific aspect ratio during resizing.

option.name: autoHide
option.desc: Whether the handles should hide when the user is not hovering over the element.

option.name: cancel
option.desc: Prevents resizing from starting on specified elements.

option.name: containment
option.desc: Constrains resizing to within the bounds of the specified element or region.

type.name: Selector
type.desc: The resizable element will be contained to the bounding box of the first element found by the selector. If no element is found, no containment will be set.

type.name: Element
type.desc: The resizable element will be contained to the bounding box of this element.

option.name: delay
option.desc: Tolerance, in milliseconds, for when resizing should start. If specified, resizing will not start until after mouse is moved beyond duration. This can help prevent unintended resizing when clicking on an element.

option.name: distance
option.desc: Tolerance, in pixels, for when resizing should start. If specified, resizing will not start until after mouse is moved beyond distance. This can help prevent unintended resizing when clicking on an element.

option.name: ghost
option.desc: If set to true, a semi-transparent helper element is shown for resizing.

option.name: grid
option.desc: Snaps the resizing element to a grid, every x and y pixels. Array values: [ x, y ].

option.name: handles
option.desc: Which handles can be used for resizing.

type.name: String
type.desc: A comma delimited list of any of the following: n, e, s, w, ne, se, sw, nw, all. The necessary handles will be auto-generated by the plugin.

type.name: Object
type.desc: The following keys are supported: { n, e, s, w, ne, se, sw, nw }. The value of any specified should be a jQuery selector matching the child element of the resizable to use as that handle. If the handle is not a child of the resizable, you can pass in the DOMElement or a valid jQuery object directly.

option.name: helper
option.desc: A class name that will be added to a proxy element to outline the resize during the drag of the resize handle. Once the resize is complete, the original element is sized.

option.name: maxHeight
option.desc: The maximum height the resizable should be allowed to resize to.

option.name: maxWidth
option.desc: The maximum width the resizable should be allowed to resize to.

option.name: minHeight
option.desc: The minimum height the resizable should be allowed to resize to.

option.name: minWidth
option.desc: The minimum width the resizable should be allowed to resize to.

event.name: start
event.desc: This event is triggered at the start of a resize operation.

property.name: element
property.desc: The jQuery object representing the element to be resized

property.name: helper
property.desc: The jQuery object representing the helper that's being resized

property.name: originalElement
property.desc: The jQuery object representing the original element before it is wrapped

property.name: originalPosition
property.desc: The position represented as { left, top } before the resizable is resized

property.name: originalSize
property.desc: The size represented as { width, height } before the resizable is resized

property.name: position
property.desc: The current position represented as { left, top }

property.name: size
property.desc: The current size represented as { width, height }

event.desc: This event is triggered during the resize, on the drag of the resize handler.
